item.title: Adapt your beauty routine to the changing weather conditions
item.description: Mintel Beauty & Personal Care (BPC) has recognized a new global beauty trend: seasonality. This trend reflects how different weather conditions influence beauty routines. Source: Mintel website. According to Mintel BPC, product launches related to this trend significantly increased from 9.8% in 2011 to 11.1% in 2014. This is particularly noticeable in facial skincare, where seasonal product launches grew from a mere 0.5% in 2009 to 1.2% in 2014. Jane Henderson, Global President of Mintelâ€™s Beauty and Personal Care Division, notes a growing consumer awareness of how environmental changes impact their skin and hair.

item.title: Australians are worried about the amount of sugar in fizzy drinks
item.description: Australia’s carbonated soft drink (CSD) market is experiencing ongoing challenges due to consumer worries about sugar content, as reported by Mintel, a global market intelligence firm. Mintel predicts that the total sales volume of CSDs in Australia will likely decrease by 2.3% in 2017, following a 4.7% drop from 2014 to 2016. Mintel’s research suggests that growing awareness of sugar’s negative effects has prompted many Australians to reevaluate their sugar consumption.

item.title: The beauty industry acknowledges the growing demand in Asia for products that promote relaxation and stress relief
item.description: A recent report by market intelligence agency Mintel reveals that the Asia-Pacific region produced one-third of all new beauty and personal care products aimed at relaxation and stress relief in the first nine months of 2018. This represents a significant increase from 2015 when the region accounted for only 26% of similar global product launches. Sharon Kwek, Senior Innovation and Insights Analyst, Beauty and Personal Care at Mintel, addressed the in-cosmetics Asia event stating that today’s fast-paced, demanding world has normalized stress.

item.title: The top goal for urban Australians is to spend more time with their family
item.description: The increasing presence of technology in everyday life has led many Australians to desire a better work-life balance. Market intelligence agency Mintel reports that 38% of Australians are hoping to achieve this balance in the coming year. Mintel’s research indicates that more than half of Australians living in metropolitan areas (51%) want to prioritize spending time with family in the next year. This desire is even more pronounced in families with three or more members, reaching 60%.

item.title: The beauty industry is increasingly prioritizing sustainability
item.description: The beauty industry needs a complete overhaul in its approach to sustainability and zero waste, focusing on every part of the process, according to market intelligence agency Mintel. The company highlights “Sub-Zero Waste” as a major trend that will shape the global beauty and personal care markets in the years to come. The zero-waste movement is picking up speed as consumers become increasingly affected by environmental problems like natural disasters and water scarcity.
